p:
Orchidaceae is the second largest family after Composite, and the largest family of monocotyledonous plants
1– 3 . More than 700 genera and more than 20,000 species were identified in the family Orchidaceae, which account for 8 percent of all flowering plants
1, 2, 4– 7 . Orchids mainly distribute in the tropical and subtropical regions of the world, and a few species grow in the temperate regions
2– 4, 8, 9 .
